conclusion: Liquid flows out from points A, B, and C.
Point A is located above the white baffle.
The white baffle directs the flow towards the left side of the channel.
The liquid will continue flowing downward and will be guided by the black baffle.
The black baffle further directs the flow towards the left.
The liquid will eventually reach the bottom and flow into container D.
Point B is located above the yellow baffle.
The yellow baffle directs the flow towards the center of the channel.
The liquid will continue flowing downward and will be guided by the blue baffle.
The blue baffle further directs the flow towards the center.
The liquid will eventually reach the bottom and flow into container E.
Point C is located above the blue baffle.
The blue baffle directs the flow towards the right side of the channel.
The liquid will continue flowing downward and will be guided by the orange baffle.
The orange baffle further directs the flow towards the right.
The liquid will eventually reach the bottom and flow into container F.
Liquid from point A will flow into container D.
Liquid from point B will flow into container E.
Liquid from point C will flow into container F.
